intro: Pimelea glauca var. major, commonly known as the silver leaf pimelea, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a shrub characterized by its narrow, silver-green leaves that are covered in fine, glandular hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
